subject: p15114531
History: Acute onset of stridor, assess airway.
Impression: AP chest compared to : Unfortunately the region of the larynx where one would look for a cause of stridor, is not included on this study. There is a suggestion of narrowing of the airway, but that can be a normal finding in an elderly patient. Lungs are clear. Heart size is normal. There is mild widening of the mediastinum which could be due to venous engorgement, and a vertically oriented air collection projecting to the left of the trachea along the aortic arch could be a swallow in the esophagus, however given concern about esophageal perforation, CT scanning is indicated to exclude air and fluid in the mediastinum. Dr. I discussed this case by telephone at the time of dictation.
